result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas A Underwood was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Thomas A Underwood was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond applied. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.

Must not possess or consume alcoholic beverages. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.  
Must not operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

supervisions.notes: Court grants Huber and good time. Must report to jail by 5:00 PM on 5/6/2016.

AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  Enclosed is an assessment information sheet.  Also enclosed is an assessment referral form.  To set up an appointment, call the number on the assessment information sheet.

Cash bond applied. In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.
